intro: Swainsona beasleyana, commonly known as the Beasley's glorybower, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of northern Australia. It is characterized by its striking, showy yellow flowers that bloom in clusters during the warmer months. The plant has a woody stem and produces small, bean-like pods that contain its seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Swainsona beasleyana is often found in shrublands and open woodlands, contributing to the biodiversity of its native habitat.
